alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Grant; Kay; Noble (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 10 at 3:18AM CDT until June 10 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Kay County in northern Oklahoma... Northern Noble County in northern Oklahoma... Eastern Grant County in northern Oklahoma... Northeastern Garfield County in northern Oklahoma... * Until 400 AM CDT. * At 317 AM CDT, the leading edge of winds from a line of severe thunderstorms was located along a line extending from 6 miles east of Winfield to near Oxford to 7 miles northeast of South Haven to 6 miles west of Caldwell, moving south at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ponca City, Blackwell, Tonkawa, Medford, Newkirk, Garber, Billings, Lamont, Kaw City, Breckenridge, Marland, Braman, Hunter, Deer Creek, Kildare, Renfrow, Chilocco, Kaw Lake, Hardy and Nardin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
